title: FlexTok: Resampling Images into 1D Token Sequences of Flexible Length
author: Roman Bachmann (Apple), Jesse Allardice (Apple), David Mizrahi (Apple), Enrico Fini (Apple), Oguzhan Fatih Kar (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne), Elmira Amirloo (Apple), Alaaeldin El-Nouby (Apple), Amir Zamir (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne), Afshin Dehghan (Apple)
relevance_why: The concept of variable-length tokenization and the hierarchical representation of information could inspire new approaches in text-to-audio generation or audio manipulation tasks, particularly in enhancing adaptability and efficiency in generating audio responses.
background: FlexTok enables the conversion of 2D images into flexible-length 1D token sequences, allowing for a more efficient way to represent images that can adapt to their complexity.
contribution: FlexTok introduces a hierarchical approach to image tokenization to solve the issue of fixed-length representations, achieving high-quality reconstructions with fewer tokens.

technical_comparison.previous_methods: Traditional tokenization methods use fixed-length sequences, making them less efficient for images with varying complexity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing a hierarchical 1D tokenization method that adapts to the content's complexity, thus allowing generation with as few as one token.

key_innovation: FlexTok's unique ability to adjust token length based on the image's semantic and geometric information allows for faster and more efficient image generation.
real_world_impact: This method could streamline the generation of images and potentially improve the performance of models in various applications, including text-to-image synthesis and interactive media.

new_terms.autoregressive models: **Autoregressive models** are statistical models that predict future values based on past values, commonly used in time series forecasting and generative tasks.
new_terms.rectified flow decoder: **Rectified flow decoder** refers to a type of generative model that uses flow-based techniques with rectification, allowing for the reconstruction of high-dimensional data from compressed representations.
